definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: I press the starter and the old engine stuttered into life.
sentences.chinese: 我按了起动装置，那具老引擎断断续续地发动起来。

sentences.english: I spent a fitful night in the mud.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚在泥地里断断续续地睡了一夜。

sentences.english: The outer-bone soft tissue masses were demonstrated in the majority cases with discontinuous bone shell.
sentences.chinese: 骨外软组织肿块多出现在骨壳断续或不完整的病例。

sentences.english: Seams in the anorthosite series are only intermittently exposed.
sentences.chinese: 斜长岩组中的矿层仅断续出露。

sentences.english: Darwin lived in this room, on and off, for nearly five years.
sentences.chinese: 达尔文就住在这里，断断续续，将近五年。

sentences.english: They had an on-and-off relationship for one year.
sentences.chinese: 他们一年来有断断续续的感情。

sentences.english: He received primary education brokenly when he was a kid.
sentences.chinese: 他小时候只断断续续地接受过初等教育。

sentences.english: It's been raining on and off all morning.
sentences.chinese: 雨断断续续地下了一早上。

sentences.english: G had worked in the company off and on for two years before G went abroad.
sentences.chinese: 出国前我在这家公司断断续续地工作过两年。

sentences.english: Through the open windows snatches of melody float on the night air.
sentences.chinese: 乐曲断断续续地从敞开的窗户中飘出，在夜空中回荡。

sentences.english: He just slept fitfully last night because he has to take care of the baby.
sentences.chinese: 他昨晚只有断断续续的睡，因为他得照顾宝宝。

sentences.english: A trap is a software-generated interrupt.
sentences.chinese: 一个陷阱是一个软体产生的断续。

sentences.english: Intermittent sound from the cloud-table, melodious rhyme to the intramural invasion.
sentences.chinese: 断续声从云表落，悠扬韵向壁间侵。

sentences.english: A lot of you grew up with inconsistent love.
sentences.chinese: 很多人是在断断续续的爱中成长的。

sentences.english: “Our moments of ecstasy have become far too intermittent,” she continued.
sentences.chinese: “我们之间狂喜的时刻太断断续续了，”她继续说。

definition: sinuous/meandering/to take a circuitous route/to toss about/vicissitudes/variant of 婉轉|婉转[wan3 zhuan3]
to talk in one's sleep/crazy talk
deep and somber/see also 窈窈[yao3 yao3]
low and unhurried (voice etc)/low and gently sloping (terrain)
lit. as if weeping and complaining (idiom)/fig. mournful (music or singing)
hanging by a thread/very precarious/almost extinct/(of sound) linger on faintly
